newsitem.title: FINLAND: TALLINK HAD UNCH 1.7 MLN PASSENGERS IN 1996 -STT.
newsitem.headline: TALLINK HAD UNCH 1.7 MLN PASSENGERS IN 1996 -STT.

text.p: Estonian ferry operator Tallink carried over 1.7 million passengers between Tallinn and Helsinki in 1996 and expects to carry more than two million this year, Finnish news agency STT reported on Friday.
The 1996 passenger figure was almost unchanged from 1995, STT said.
Tallink is now operating two vessels, the M/S Meloodia and the M/S Georg Ots, between the Estonian and Finnish capitals, it said.
In the spring, it will introduce a catamaran-type vessel for summer service and a passenger ferry for 20-hour cruises, STT said.
